overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Soul Liberator
overall_perception_summary.description: Dr. Althea acts as a precise, medical-grade intervention for compromised skin, merging the rigors of Korean dermatology with a minimalist 'Clean Beauty' philosophy. It does not sell generic moisture; it sells specific 'Relief' for post-acne trauma using a proprietary 3-4-5 nutrient complex. The brand feels like a trusted dermatologist who also practices mindfulness—delivering raw clinical data (+177% hydration) wrapped in a serene, 'Soul Liberation' aesthetic.

foundation.title: The Clinical Healer
foundation.description: The brand positions itself as The Healer, deriving authority from 'Derma Inspired' science and the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences.' Its mission is pure Restoration—fixing specific pathologies like 'post-acne marks' and 'blemishes' rather than generic enhancement. It operates on a Safety First value system, prioritizing 'Clean Formula' and 'Hypoallergenic' tolerance over aggressive actives.

identity.title: The Reliable Philosopher
identity.description: The personality is The Reliable Expert—distant, authoritative, and precise—using a 'Dr.' moniker and clinical black-and-white codes. The archetype mix is dominated by The Sage (60%), seeking truth through data and transparency, supported by The Caregiver's desire to soothe. Visually, it executes a Pharma-Code identity: sterile white tubes, serif fonts, and data tables that signal the pharmacy, not the playground.

communication.title: The Data-Driven Problem Solver
communication.description: Messaging acts as The Problem Solver, hooking the user with the result ('Relief') and persuading them with Raw Data ('+177.34% Hydration'). The USP is The Specialist, owning the niche of 'Post-Acne Relief' via its proprietary '3-4-5' Signature Complex. The focus is strictly Science Education, using the PDP as a textbook to explain ingredients and clinical results.

benefits.title: Restorative Safety
benefits.description: Functionally, it delivers Restoration, acting as a 'Healer' for damaged barriers rather than a cosmetic fixer. Emotionally, it provides Relief / Safety, selling the absence of irritation ('Calming') rather than the presence of joy. Socially, it appeals to The Knowledge Club—connoisseurs who recognize the 'Dr. Althea' name and its specific K-Beauty clinical pedigree.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The brand anchors its authority in the clinic—'Dr. Althea,' 'Derma Inspired,' and specific citations of the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' (Authority: 2/5). The mission is explicitly corrective: 'Relief,' 'Post-acne,' 'Blemishes,' and 'Repair.' It is not enhancing healthy skin; it is fixing damaged skin (Mission: 1/5).
marker_1.evidence: Derma Inspired... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Post-acne marks... Blemishes... Relief Cream

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Derm-Validated) + Slider B (Pathology Cure) aligns perfectly with Territory 1 (The Healer). The content is heavy on medical authority and symptom correction.

marker_2.reasoning: The scope is laser-focused on micro-correction: 'post-acne marks,' 'blemishes,' and 'irritated skin' (Scope: 1/5). The access barrier feels elevated/aspirational due to the 'Dr.' branding, the 'Soul Liberation Project' tagline, and the highly specific clinical data stats (+177.34%), which code as 'advanced' rather than democratic mass-market (Access: 2/5).
marker_2.evidence: Post-acne marks... Blemishes... Uneven skin tone... Increase in Skin Hydration +177.34%... Soul Liberation Project

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Micro-correction scope combined with aspirational/scientific signaling maps to Territory 2. The brand presents as an advanced solution for specific issues.

marker_3.reasoning: Despite the clinical stats, the primary value is safety/tolerance. 'Relief,' 'Calming,' 'Sensitive Skin,' and 'Vegan' dominate the front-of-pack claims (Performance: 2/5). However, transparency is high with explicit ingredient breakdowns ('345 formula') and exact percentage improvements from clinical trials (Transparency: 2/5). The combination of high-safety and high-data puts it in Territory 1.
marker_3.evidence: Relief Cream... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Skin Irritation Tested... Vegan... Increase in Skin Hydration +177.34%

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: The brand explicitly prioritizes 'Relief' and 'Soothing' (Safety) while using hard data to prove it. This is the definition of the Safety First territory.

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is stark black-and-white minimalist with serif fonts, signaling 'Professional' and 'Clinical' rather than 'Lifestyle' (Aesthetic: 2/5). The value perception is utilitarian—an 'All-in-one skincare solution' in a standard tube format, positioning it as a reliable, functional necessity for troubled skin (Value: 2/5).
marker_4.evidence: Minimalist... High-contrast black and white... All-in-one skincare solution... Dr.Althea 345 Relief Cream

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: The visual language is purely clinical/pharma (Territory 1). There is no attempt to be a 'Shelfie' brand; it looks like a prescription.

marker_5.reasoning: The tone is cool and composed. 'Dr. Althea' speaks with the distance of a clinician—'Clinical trial conducted,' 'Improvement +8.88%.' There is no 'hey bestie' energy here; it is pure expertise (Warmth: 2/5). The authority is high, citing institutes and specific dermatological testing (Authority: 4/5).
marker_5.evidence: Dr. Althea... Clinical trial conducted by Korea Institute... 345 Relief Cream... Clean Formula

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Low warmth + High authority = The Reliable Expert. The brand speaks like a doctor, fitting this territory perfectly.

marker_6.reasoning: The primary archetype is The Sage (60%) because the brand leads with truth-seeking: 'Dr.', 'Clinical trial', '345 formula' (explaining the why/how). The Caregiver (30%) appears in the promise of 'Relief' and 'Soothing.' The Innocent (10%) is present in the 'Clean Formula' and 'Soul Liberation' claims. The combination of clinical truth (Sage) and purity (Innocent) places it firmly in The Philosopher territory.
marker_6.evidence: Clinical trial conducted by Korea Institute... 3-4-5 formula... Relief Cream... Soothes... Clean Formula... Soul Liberation

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Territory derived from dominant archetype group (Independence/Stability focus of Sage/Innocent).

marker_7.reasoning: The voice is pure data. '+177.34% Hydration,' '+8.88% Soothing.' It uses academic formatting (tables, footnotes about 'raw material characteristics only') and completely lacks humor or enthusiasm. It sounds like a lab report.
marker_7.evidence: Increase in Skin Hydration +177.34%... Improvement in Soothing Effect +8.88%... *raw material characteristics only

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Enthusiasm 1/5 + Formality 1/5 fits the hard rule for Territory 1 (The Clinical Authority).

marker_8.reasoning: The visual world is stark white, black text, and clinical gray. The layout is rigid, vertical, and centered, using serif typography that mimics medical journals. There is no chaos, no bright color, and no organic messiness. It is the visual language of the pharmacy.
marker_8.evidence: High-contrast black and white... Vertical text alignment... Serif and sans-serif mix... Scientific glass apparatus image
marker_8.look_and_feel: Stark, clinical minimalism with a monochromatic palette suggesting dermatological precision.
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical monochrome (White/Black) with subtle grey and medicinal green accents.

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Sterile temperature + Swiss Grid control aligns perfectly with Territory 1 (Pharma-Code).

marker_9.reasoning: The hook is 'Relief' and 'Reveal Your Radiance'—the outcome. But the persuasion is aggressively rational: 'Clinical trial,' 'Increase +177.34%.' They don't try to charm you; they try to prove the solution works with numbers. This is the logic of The Problem Solver.
marker_9.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Reveal Your Radiance... Increase in Skin Hydration +177.34%... Clinical trial conducted

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Benefit hook (Relief) + Raw Data persuasion aligns with Territory 2 (The Problem Solver).

marker_10.reasoning: The hero is 'Dr. Althea' (a persona/entity) and the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences.' The setting is explicitly the lab—represented by the image of 'Scientific glass apparatus' on the box. It is a story of formulas, testing, and chemistry, not nature or founders.
marker_10.evidence: Dr. Althea... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Scientific glass apparatus image

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Scientist protagonist + Lab setting aligns perfectly with Territory 1 (The Lab Breakthrough).

marker_11.reasoning: Validation comes from the 'Korea Institute' and 'Dermatologist Tested' badges. The proof is explicitly statistical: '+177.34%,' '+8.88%.' They rely on the authority of the white coat and the chart.
marker_11.evidence: Dermatologist Tested... Clinical trial conducted by Korea Institute... +177.34%... +8.88%

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Lab validation + Graph proof aligns with Territory 1 (Derm-Validation).

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP CLAIM (What Makes You Unique)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Problem Solver (Targets specific skin concern)
marker_12.reasoning: The USP is the '3-4-5 formula' (3 anti-inflammatory, 4 antioxidant, 5 moisturizing)—a specific Signature Complex. The scope is narrowed to 'Post-acne marks' and 'Blemishes.' It targets a specific sufferer with a specific complex, making it The Specialist.
marker_12.evidence: 3-4-5 formula contains 3 anti-inflammatory... 4 antioxidant... 5 moisturizing... Post-acne marks... Blemishes

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Signature Complex ownership + Specialist scope aligns with Territory 4 (The Specialist).

marker_13.reasoning: The visual strategy is to teach. Infographics explain the '3-4-5' formula; charts show hydration spikes. The goal is to build Trust/Thesis via clinical evidence rather than to inspire via lifestyle. It works as an educational document.
marker_13.evidence: Key Ingredients infographic... Clinical trial results box... 3-4-5 formula explanation... Scientific apparatus image

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Explainer depth + Thesis intent aligns with Territory 1 (Science Education).

marker_14.reasoning: This is not about 'maintenance'; it is about urgent 'Relief.' The mechanism is soothing and repairing 'irritated skin' and 'post-acne marks' (Action: 4/5). The outcome is 'Calming' and 'Soothing'—restoring the skin to health rather than painting a cosmetic improvement (Outcome: 2/5).
marker_14.evidence: Relief Cream... Soothes and repairs... Calming... Irritated skin... Post-acne marks

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Healer action + Sensory/Health outcome aligns with Territory 1 (Restoration).

marker_15.reasoning: The product name is 'Relief.' It addresses the anxiety of 'acne-prone' and 'sensitive' skin by offering 'Safe,' 'Clean,' and 'Tested' reassurance (Anxiety: 2/5). The emotional payoff is Comfort—returning to a normal state where skin isn't angry (Self-Perception: 2/5).
marker_15.evidence: Relief Cream... Safe for acne-prone skin... Skin Irritation Tested... Soul Liberation

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Smart Choice (because it makes sense)
marker_16.reasoning: Buying Dr. Althea is a 'Smart Choice' driven by the logic of ingredients ('Clean Formula,' 'Vegan'). It signals that the user is educated enough to look beyond drugstore brands to a curated Korean derm brand (Tribal: 3/5). The 'Soul Liberation' and 'Clean' tags appeal to The Purist who values ethical/intelligent consumption.
marker_16.evidence: Clean Formula... Vegan... Derma Inspired... Soul Liberation Project

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Rational motivation (Smart Choice) + Niche/Curated orientation maps to Territory 3 (The Purist). It's a badge of the educated skincare buyer.

marker_17.reasoning: This isn't for everyone; it's for the 'acne-prone' niche who research their ingredients. By choosing this over CeraVe, the user joins The Knowledge Club—the group that knows about '3-4-5 formulas' and 'Korea Institute' testing. The social payoff is Intellect: 'I know what works for my tricky skin.'
marker_17.evidence: 3-4-5 formula... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Professional Derma-Cosmetic Brand

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Niche group dynamic + Intellectual payoff (via complex formula claims) aligns with Territory 2 (The Knowledge Club).
